RESOLVED_ENTITIES.Transportation, Planning, and Programmin: Texas Department of Transportation, Transportation, Planning, and Programming Division
RESOLVED_ENTITIES.the Laredo Division: Texas Department of Transportation, Laredo Division

AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States Border Patrol: involved in the stop of RICARDO RODRIGUEZ, JR. and IGNACIO RODRIGUEZ, JR.; considered the behavior of vehicles' drivers in determining reasonable suspicion to stop; followed suspicious vehicles for approximately five minutes; conducted a roving stop; familiar with most vehicles on Farm-to-Market Road 2050; interacted with law enforcement during the traffic stop; involved in the arrest and questioning of IGNACIO RODRIGUEZ, JR.; location of questioning; had sufficient evidence to conclude that two vehicles were driving in tandem; agents were expected to arrive at the scene; involved in an incident where Agent Benavides asked IGNACIO RODRIGUEZ, JR. questions en route to the Border Patrol station
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States District Court: held a hearing on the pending motions to suppress and considered factors for reasonable suspicion; analyzed evidence including district traffic maps of Farm-to-Market Road 2050 and U.S. Highway 59
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Texas Department of Transportation: prepared district traffic maps of Farm-to-Market Road 2050 and U.S. Highway 59, indicating traffic flow data primarily collected and determined by the Transportation, Planning, and Programming Division in Austin; has a Laredo Division with a Director of Transportation, Planning and Development
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Texas Department of Transportation, Tran: collects and determines traffic flow data for district traffic maps
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Texas Department of Transportation, Lare: has a Director of Transportation, Planning and Development who testified about the accuracy of traffic flow data
